description: Automatically inject Helicone session headers into LLM requests for request grouping in Helicone's dashboard
installation:
## Installation

```bash
npm install -g opencode-helicone-session
# or
bun add -g opencode-helicone-session
```

Add the plugin to your `opencode.json`:

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://opencode.ai/config.json",
  "plugin": ["opencode-helicone-session"]
}
```

description: Bring Anthropic's Agent Skills Specification (v1.0) to OpenCode with auto-discovery, spec compliance, dynamic tools, and nested skills support
installation:
## Installation

Add to your `opencode.json` or `~/.config/opencode/opencode.json`:

```json
{
  "plugin": ["opencode-skills"]
}
```

OpenCode auto-installs plugins on startup.

### Version Pinning

Pin to a specific version:

```json
{
  "plugin": ["opencode-skills@x.y.z"]
}
```

description: Auto-inject TypeScript and Svelte types into file reads with lookup tools, token budget management, and import resolution
Use your ChatGPT Plus/Pro subscription instead of API credits with OAuth authentication for OpenAI's Codex backend
installation:
## Installation

Add to your `opencode.json`:

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://opencode.ai/config.json",
  "plugin": ["opencode-openai-codex-auth@4.1.1"]
}
```

Then run:

```bash
opencode auth login
```

Select "OpenAI" â†’ "ChatGPT Plus/Pro (Codex Subscription)"

See the [full configuration](https://github.com/numman-ali/opencode-openai-codex-auth/blob/main/config/full-opencode.json) for all model variants.

description: Use your existing Gemini plan instead of API billing with Google OAuth authentication
installation:
## Installation

Add the plugin to your OpenCode config:

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://opencode.ai/config.json",
  "plugin": ["opencode-gemini-auth"]
}
```

Then run:

```bash
opencode auth login
```

Choose the Google provider and select **OAuth with Google (Gemini CLI)**.

description: Use Antigravity's free models with multi-account load balancing, automatic endpoint fallback, and access to models like Gemini 3 Pro and Claude via Google credentials
installation:
## Installation

Add the plugin to your OpenCode config:

```json
{
  "plugin": ["opencode-antigravity-auth@1.1.4"]
}
```

Then run:

```bash
opencode auth login
```

Select **Google** as the provider and **OAuth with Google (Antigravity)**.

description: Google Antigravity OAuth Plugin with multi-account load balancing, Google Search tool, cross-model conversations, and interleaved thinking support
installation:
## Installation

Add the plugin to your OpenCode config:

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://opencode.ai/config.json",
  "plugin": ["opencode-google-antigravity-auth"]
}
```

Then run:

```bash
opencode auth login
```

Choose the Google provider and select **OAuth with Google (Antigravity)**.

description: Optimize token usage by intelligently pruning obsolete tool outputs from conversation history with deduplication, prune tool, and on-idle analysis
installation:
## Installation

Add to your OpenCode config:

```json
{
  "plugin": ["@tarquinen/opencode-dcp@latest"]
}
```

Using `@latest` ensures you always get the newest version automatically when OpenCode starts.

Restart OpenCode. The plugin will automatically start optimizing your sessions.

description: Add native websearch support with inline citations and source lists for supported providers using Google grounded style
installation:
## Installation

Add `opencode-websearch-cited` to your `~/.config/opencode/opencode.json`.

**IMPORTANT**: Put `opencode-websearch-cited` LAST in the `plugin` list to avoid impacting other plugins' auth process.

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://opencode.ai/config.json",
  "plugin": [
    "...other plugins",
    "opencode-websearch-cited@1.1.1"
  ]
}
```

Then configure a `websearch_cited` model in your provider options.

description: Enable AI agents to run background processes in a PTY, send interactive input, and read output with regex filtering
installation:
## Installation

Add the plugin to your OpenCode config:

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://opencode.ai/config.json",
  "plugin": ["opencode-pty"]
}
```

That's it. OpenCode will automatically install the plugin on next run.

description: Track OpenCode usage with WakaTime including automatic CLI management, detailed file tracking, and AI coding metrics
installation:
## Installation

Ensure you have a WakaTime API key configured in `~/.wakatime.cfg`:

```ini
[settings]
api_key = waka_your_api_key_here
```

Clone, build, and symlink the plugin:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/angristan/opencode-wakatime
cd opencode-wakatime
npm install && npm run build

mkdir -p ~/.config/opencode/plugin
ln -s "$(pwd)/dist/index.js" ~/.config/opencode/plugin/wakatime.js
```

description: Clean up markdown tables produced by LLMs with concealment mode support, alignment handling, and code block preservation
installation:
## Installation

Add the plugin to your `.opencode/opencode.jsonc`:

```json
{
  "plugin": ["@franlol/opencode-md-table-formatter@0.0.3"]
}
```

description: Battery-included plugin with background agents, pre-built LSP/AST/MCP tools, curated agents with proper models, and Claude Code compatibility layer
installation:
## Installation

Add to your OpenCode config:

```bash
mkdir -p ~/.config/opencode
```

If `~/.config/opencode/opencode.json` exists, add `oh-my-opencode` to the plugin array. Otherwise create:

```json
{
  "plugin": ["oh-my-opencode"]
}
```

Then run:

```bash
opencode auth login
```

Configure authentication for your preferred providers (Anthropic, Google, OpenAI).
